titles.title: Personal Philanthropy Account Act of 2006
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to encourage private philanthropy.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 5/1/2006--Introduced. Personal Philanthropy Account Act of 2006 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a tax deduction (whether or not the taxpayer itemizes deductions) for cash contributions to a personal philanthropy account. Defines "personal philanthropy account" as a tax-exempt trust created to make distributions for charitable purposes. Sets forth rules providing for default charitable distributions in the event of an account holder's death and minimum annual distribution requirements.Allows an exclusion from the gross income of an employee for contributions made by an employer to the employee's personal philanthropy account.
